definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
Sagittarius (constellation and sign of the zodiac)/popular variant of 人馬座|人马座[Ren2 ma3 zuo4]

sentences.english: It's the year of the shooter, and Half-Life and Unreal are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 這是一年的射手，和半條命和虛幻的介紹。

sentences.english: The Sagittarius' attitude to love drives Virgo out of his/her mind.
sentences.chinese: 射手座對於愛情的態度會讓處女座發瘋。

sentences.english: He is joint tournament top scorer with three goals.
sentences.chinese: 他現在以三個進球領先該盃賽射手榜。

sentences.english: Running target and clay-pigeon shooter shall shoot at standing position with both hands holding the gun.
sentences.chinese: 移動靶和飛碟射手採用立姿雙手持槍進行射擊。

sentences.english: Actually, this trade is likely to be totally irrelevant. But Wafer can shoot the rock, and Portland likes shooters.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓦佛能在三分線外出手，而開拓者喜歡射手。

sentences.english: The freedom is necessary for Sagittarius .
sentences.chinese: 自由對於射手座來說是必須的。

sentences.english: There was once a gifted marksman.
In every tower stands an archer with a bow in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 每座塔上均杵着一名手握弓箭的射手。

sentences.english: This makes the Sagittarius woman intriguing as well as interesting.
sentences.chinese: 這讓射手座的女人又迷人又有趣。

sentences.english: It's time to let your Sagittarius charm take over not your pushiness .
sentences.chinese: 是時候發揮妳射手座魅力了，不要一意孤行啊。

sentences.english: He's a marvellous stricker of the ball with either foot.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個兩腳都會控球並了不起的射手。

sentences.english: The shooter bent weapons on her.
The archer's shot was a perfect bull's-eye.
sentences.chinese: 射手的那一箭正中靶心。

definition: one who has mastered the sutras (Buddhism)
member of same class, team, work group etc/teammate
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
